column3:
Bobby's grandmother was studying at a school in New York City.  She lived at the school
ewlineyear round.  So Bobby's mother put him on a bus to the city and his grandmother picked him
ewlineup at the Port Authority bus stop.  They took the train back to the school.  They put
ewlineBobby's backpack on a rack in the guest room.  Then Bobby and his grandmother went out for
ewlinea walk.  They stopped at a corner shop for pizza and sodas.  Then they walked to the
ewlineEmpire State Building.  At the top of the Empire State Building they looked out over the
ewlinecity.  They counted all the bridges and looked at all the tall buildings.  Bobby bought
ewlinethree postcards and a little snow globe in the shop. Then they took the elevator back to
ewlinethe ground floor.  Next they took a yellow cab to Central Park.  They rode the carousel
ewlineand went to the zoo.  Bobby's favorite animals were the monkeys.  He did not like the
ewlinesnakes at all.  After they had ice cream cones, Bobby and his grandmother took the train
ewlineback to her school.  They had salads for supper.  Then they read a story together.
ewlineBobby's grandmother made up her sofa bed for Bobby as they made plans for the next day.
ewlineBobby wanted to know if they could go to a baseball game.  His grandmother said she would
ewlineget tickets.
column4: one: Where were Bobby and his grandmother when they counted all the bridges?
column8: At the top of the Empire State Building.
column9: one: How did Bobby and his grandmother get back to her school from the Port Authority bus stop?
column11: They rode in a yellow cab.
column14: multiple: What did Bobby buy before taking the elevator to the ground floor?
column16: Three postcards and a snow globe.
column19: multiple: What kind of tickets did Bobby's grandmother say she would try to get?
